intro: Physaria pinetorum, commonly known as the pinebrush blazer, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands and along forest edges. Physaria pinetorum is drought-tolerant and well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
